thread.title: Central-Phenix City sophomore Justyn Ross earns offer
thread.title_full: Central-Phenix City sophomore Justyn Ross earns Auburn offer | AL.com

author: Drew Champlin | dchamplin@al.com
title: Central-Phenix City sophomore Justyn Ross earns offer
text:
Central-Phenix City dropped a game to Opelika two weeks ago, but sophomore Justyn Ross certainly got Auburn's attention.
The 6-foot-4, 190-pound receiver, ranked as one of five four-star recruits in the state of Alabama by 247Sports in early 2018 rankings, earned an offer from Auburn on Wednesday.
Central-Phenix City sophomore Justyn Ross earned an Auburn offer on Wednesday (photo courtesy 247Sports) 247Sports Ross scored on a 63-yard touchdown pass where he did most of the work, taking a short crossing route the distance. He also caught a 69-yard touchdown pass, bouncing off three defenders, according to the Ledger-Enquirer .
"I think the Auburn offer came from when I had a great game (against Opelika) when a coach (from Auburn) came to our game," Ross said. "But this offer means a lot to me because Auburn is a great school and has a good football program."
Senior cornerback John Broussard is committed to Auburn, and the Tigers are pursuing highly-rated junior linebacker Markail Benton . Right now, Auburn is one of the first schools entered into the Ross sweepstakes.
Auburn joined Missouri, Kentucky and Mississippi State as schools who have offered from the SEC.
"I was an Auburn fan when I was younger but when I got into the recruiting process, I started liking a lot of different teams." Ross said.
Ross is also a talented basketball player for the Red Devils.
Check out some film.
